segment.source: Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views
segment.target: Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views

segment.source: Display customizable maps in your app by using the MapControl class.
segment.target: Display customizable maps in your app by using the MapControl class.

segment.source: This topic also introduces aerial 3D and Streetside views.
segment.target: This topic also introduces aerial 3D and Streetside views.

segment.source: Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views
segment.target: Display maps with 2D, 3D, and Streetside views

segment.source: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
segment.target: Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

segment.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive
segment.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the archive

segment.source: Display customizable maps in your app by using the MapControl class.
segment.target: Display customizable maps in your app by using the MapControl class.

segment.source: This topic also introduces aerial 3D and Streetside views.
segment.target: This topic also introduces aerial 3D and Streetside views.

segment.source: Tip To learn more about using maps in your app, download the following sample from the Windows-universal-samples repo on GitHub.
segment.target: Tip To learn more about using maps in your app, download the following sample from the Windows-universal-samples repo on GitHub.

segment.source: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample
segment.target: Universal Windows Platform (UWP) map sample

segment.source: Add the map control to your app
segment.target: Add the map control to your app

segment.source: Display a map on a XAML page by adding a MapControl.
segment.target: Display a map on a XAML page by adding a MapControl.

segment.source: To use the MapControl, you must declare the Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps namespace in the XAML page or in your code.
segment.target: To use the MapControl, you must declare the Windows.UI.Xaml.Controls.Maps namespace in the XAML page or in your code.

segment.source: If you drag the control from the Toolbox, this namespace declaration is added automatically.
segment.target: If you drag the control from the Toolbox, this namespace declaration is added automatically.

segment.source: If you add the MapControl to the XAML page manually, you must add the namespace declaration manually at the top of the page.
segment.target: If you add the MapControl to the XAML page manually, you must add the namespace declaration manually at the top of the page.

segment.source: The following example displays a basic map control and configures the map to display the zoom and tilt controls in addition to accepting touch inputs.
segment.target: The following example displays a basic map control and configures the map to display the zoom and tilt controls in addition to accepting touch inputs.

segment.source: For more info about customizing the appearance of the map, see Configure the map.
segment.target: For more info about customizing the appearance of the map, see Configure the map.

segment.source: If you add the map control in your code, you must declare the namespace manually at the top of the code file.
segment.target: If you add the map control in your code, you must declare the namespace manually at the top of the code file.

segment.source: Get and set a maps authentication key
segment.target: Get and set a maps authentication key

segment.source: Before you can use MapControl and map services, you must specify the maps authentication key as the value of the MapServiceToken property.
segment.target: Before you can use MapControl and map services, you must specify the maps authentication key as the value of the MapServiceToken property.

segment.source: In the previous examples, replace with the key you get from the Bing Maps Developer Center.
segment.target: In the previous examples, replace with the key you get from the Bing Maps Developer Center.

segment.source: The text Warning: MapServiceToken not specified continues to appear below the control until you specify the maps authentication key.
segment.target: The text Warning: MapServiceToken not specified continues to appear below the control until you specify the maps authentication key.

segment.source: For more info about getting and setting a maps authentication key, see Request a maps authentication key.
segment.target: For more info about getting and setting a maps authentication key, see Request a maps authentication key.

segment.source: Set a starting location for the map
segment.target: Set a starting location for the map

segment.source: Set the location to display on the map by specifying the Center property of the MapControl in your code or by binding the property in your XAML markup.
segment.target: Set the location to display on the map by specifying the Center property of the MapControl in your code or by binding the property in your XAML markup.

segment.source: The following example displays a map with the city of Seattle as its center.
segment.target: The following example displays a map with the city of Seattle as its center.

segment.source: Tip Since a string can't be converted to a Geopoint, you can't specify a value for the Center property in XAML markup unless you use data binding.
segment.target: Tip Since a string can't be converted to a Geopoint, you can't specify a value for the Center property in XAML markup unless you use data binding.

segment.source: (This limitation also applies to the MapControl.Location attached property.)
segment.target: (This limitation also applies to the MapControl.Location attached property.)

segment.source: an example of the map control.
segment.target: an example of the map control.

segment.source: Set the current location of the map
segment.target: Set the current location of the map

segment.source: Before your app can access the user’s location, your app must call the RequestAccessAsync method.
segment.target: Before your app can access the user’s location, your app must call the RequestAccessAsync method.

segment.source: At that time, your app must be in the foreground and RequestAccessAsync must be called from the UI thread.
segment.target: At that time, your app must be in the foreground and RequestAccessAsync must be called from the UI thread.

segment.source: Until the user grants your app permission to their location, your app can't access location data.
segment.target: Until the user grants your app permission to their location, your app can't access location data.

segment.source: Get the current location of the device (if location is available) by using the GetGeopositionAsync method of the Geolocator class.
segment.target: Get the current location of the device (if location is available) by using the GetGeopositionAsync method of the Geolocator class.

segment.source: To obtain the corresponding Geopoint, use the Point property of the geoposition's geocoordinate.
segment.target: To obtain the corresponding Geopoint, use the Point property of the geoposition's geocoordinate.

segment.source: For more info, see Get current location.
segment.target: For more info, see Get current location.

segment.source: When you display your device's location on a map, consider displaying graphics and setting the zoom level based on the accuracy of the location data.
segment.target: When you display your device's location on a map, consider displaying graphics and setting the zoom level based on the accuracy of the location data.

segment.source: For more info, see Guidelines for location-aware apps.
segment.target: For more info, see Guidelines for location-aware apps.

segment.source: Change the location of the map
segment.target: Change the location of the map

segment.source: To change the location that appears in a 2D map, call one of the overloads of the TrySetViewAsync method.
segment.target: To change the location that appears in a 2D map, call one of the overloads of the TrySetViewAsync method.

segment.source: Use that method to specify new values for Center, ZoomLevel, Heading, and Pitch.
segment.target: Use that method to specify new values for Center, ZoomLevel, Heading, and Pitch.

segment.source: You can also specify an optional animation to use when the view changes by providing a constant from the MapAnimationKind enumeration.
segment.target: You can also specify an optional animation to use when the view changes by providing a constant from the MapAnimationKind enumeration.

segment.source: To change the location of a 3D map, use the TrySetSceneAsync method instead.
segment.target: To change the location of a 3D map, use the TrySetSceneAsync method instead.

segment.source: For more info, see Display 3D views.
segment.target: For more info, see Display 3D views.

segment.source: Call the TrySetViewBoundsAsync method to display the contents of a GeoboundingBox on the map.
segment.target: Call the TrySetViewBoundsAsync method to display the contents of a GeoboundingBox on the map.

segment.source: Use this method, for example, to display a route or a portion of a route on the map.
segment.target: Use this method, for example, to display a route or a portion of a route on the map.

segment.source: For more info, see Display routes and directions on a map.
segment.target: For more info, see Display routes and directions on a map.

segment.source: Configure the map
segment.target: Configure the map

segment.source: Configure the map and its appearance by setting the values of the following properties of the MapControl.
segment.target: Configure the map and its appearance by setting the values of the following properties of the MapControl.

segment.source: Map settings
segment.target: Map settings

segment.source: Set the center of the map to a geographic point by setting the Center property.
segment.target: Set the center of the map to a geographic point by setting the Center property.

segment.source: Set the zoom level of the map by setting the ZoomLevel property to a value between 1 and 20.
segment.target: Set the zoom level of the map by setting the ZoomLevel property to a value between 1 and 20.

segment.source: Set the rotation of the map by setting the Heading property, where 0 or 360 degrees = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, and 270 = West.
segment.target: Set the rotation of the map by setting the Heading property, where 0 or 360 degrees = North, 90 = East, 180 = South, and 270 = West.

segment.source: Set the tilt of the map by setting the DesiredPitch property to a value between 0 and 65 degrees.
segment.target: Set the tilt of the map by setting the DesiredPitch property to a value between 0 and 65 degrees.

segment.source: Map appearance
segment.target: Map appearance

segment.source: Specify the type of map - for example, a road map or an aerial map - by setting the Style property with one of the MapStyle constants.
segment.target: Specify the type of map - for example, a road map or an aerial map - by setting the Style property with one of the MapStyle constants.

segment.source: Set the color scheme of the map to light or dark by setting the ColorScheme property with one of the MapColorScheme constants.
segment.target: Set the color scheme of the map to light or dark by setting the ColorScheme property with one of the MapColorScheme constants.

segment.source: Show information on the map by setting the values of the following properties of the MapControl.
segment.target: Show information on the map by setting the values of the following properties of the MapControl.

segment.source: Display buildings and landmarks on the map by enabling or disabling the LandmarksVisible property.
segment.target: Display buildings and landmarks on the map by enabling or disabling the LandmarksVisible property.

segment.source: Display pedestrian features such as public stairs on the map by enabling or disabling the PedestrianFeaturesVisible property.
segment.target: Display pedestrian features such as public stairs on the map by enabling or disabling the PedestrianFeaturesVisible property.

segment.source: Display traffic on the map by enabling or disabling the TrafficFlowVisible property.
segment.target: Display traffic on the map by enabling or disabling the TrafficFlowVisible property.

segment.source: Specify whether the watermark is displayed on the map by setting the WatermarkMode property to one of the MapWatermarkMode constants.
segment.target: Specify whether the watermark is displayed on the map by setting the WatermarkMode property to one of the MapWatermarkMode constants.

segment.source: Display a driving or walking route on the map by adding a MapRouteView to the Routes collection of the Map control.
segment.target: Display a driving or walking route on the map by adding a MapRouteView to the Routes collection of the Map control.

segment.source: For more info and an example, see Display routes and directions on a map.
segment.target: For more info and an example, see Display routes and directions on a map.

segment.source: For info about how to display pushpins, shapes, and XAML controls in the MapControl, see Display points of interest (POI) on a map.
segment.target: For info about how to display pushpins, shapes, and XAML controls in the MapControl, see Display points of interest (POI) on a map.

segment.source: Display Streetside views
segment.target: Display Streetside views

segment.source: A Streetside view is a street-level perspective of a location that appears on top of the map control.
segment.target: A Streetside view is a street-level perspective of a location that appears on top of the map control.

segment.source: an example of a streetside view of the map control.
segment.target: an example of a streetside view of the map control.

segment.source: Consider the experience "inside" the Streetside view separate from the map originally displayed in the map control.
segment.target: Consider the experience "inside" the Streetside view separate from the map originally displayed in the map control.

segment.source: For example, changing the location in the Streetside view does not change the location or appearance of the map "under" the Streetside view.
segment.target: For example, changing the location in the Streetside view does not change the location or appearance of the map "under" the Streetside view.

segment.source: After you close the Streetside view (by clicking the X in the upper right corner of the control), the original map remains unchanged.
segment.target: After you close the Streetside view (by clicking the X in the upper right corner of the control), the original map remains unchanged.

segment.source: To display a Streetside view
segment.target: To display a Streetside view

segment.source: Determine if Streetside views are supported on the device by checking IsStreetsideSupported.
segment.target: Determine if Streetside views are supported on the device by checking IsStreetsideSupported.

segment.source: If Streetside view is supported, create a StreetsidePanorama near the specified location by calling FindNearbyAsync.
segment.target: If Streetside view is supported, create a StreetsidePanorama near the specified location by calling FindNearbyAsync.

segment.source: Determine if a nearby panorama was found by checking if the StreetsidePanorama is not null
segment.target: Determine if a nearby panorama was found by checking if the StreetsidePanorama is not null

segment.source: If a nearby panorama was found, create a StreetsideExperience for the map control's CustomExperience property.
segment.target: If a nearby panorama was found, create a StreetsideExperience for the map control's CustomExperience property.

segment.source: This example shows how to display a Streetside view similar to the previous image.
segment.target: This example shows how to display a Streetside view similar to the previous image.

segment.source: Note The overview map will not appear if the map control is sized too small.
segment.target: Note The overview map will not appear if the map control is sized too small.

segment.source: Display aerial 3D views
segment.target: Display aerial 3D views

segment.source: Specify a 3D perspective of the map by using the MapScene class.
segment.target: Specify a 3D perspective of the map by using the MapScene class.

segment.source: The map scene represents the 3D view that appears in the map.
segment.target: The map scene represents the 3D view that appears in the map.

segment.source: The MapCamera class represents the position of the camera that would display such a view.
segment.target: The MapCamera class represents the position of the camera that would display such a view.

segment.source: To make buildings and other features on the map surface appear in 3D, set the map control's Style property to MapStyle.Aerial3DWithRoads.
segment.target: To make buildings and other features on the map surface appear in 3D, set the map control's Style property to MapStyle.Aerial3DWithRoads.

segment.source: This is an example of a 3D view with the Aerial3DWithRoads style.
segment.target: This is an example of a 3D view with the Aerial3DWithRoads style.

segment.source: an example of a 3d map view.
segment.target: an example of a 3d map view.

segment.source: To display a 3D view
segment.target: To display a 3D view

segment.source: Determine if 3D views are supported on the device by checking Is3DSupported.
segment.target: Determine if 3D views are supported on the device by checking Is3DSupported.

segment.source: If 3D views is supported, set the map control's Style property to MapStyle.Aerial3DWithRoads.
segment.target: If 3D views is supported, set the map control's Style property to MapStyle.Aerial3DWithRoads.

segment.source: Create a MapScene object using one of the many CreateFrom methods, such as CreateFromLocationAndRadius and CreateFromCamera.
segment.target: Create a MapScene object using one of the many CreateFrom methods, such as CreateFromLocationAndRadius and CreateFromCamera.

segment.source: Call TrySetSceneAsync to display the 3D view.
segment.target: Call TrySetSceneAsync to display the 3D view.

segment.source: You can also specify an optional animation to use when the view changes by providing a constant from the MapAnimationKind enumeration.
segment.target: You can also specify an optional animation to use when the view changes by providing a constant from the MapAnimationKind enumeration.

segment.source: This example shows how to display a 3D view.
segment.target: This example shows how to display a 3D view.

segment.source: Get info about locations and elements
segment.target: Get info about locations and elements

segment.source: Get info about locations on the map by calling the following methods of the MapControl.
segment.target: Get info about locations on the map by calling the following methods of the MapControl.

segment.source: GetLocationFromOffset method - Get the geographic location that corresponds to the specified point in the viewport of the Map control.
segment.target: GetLocationFromOffset method - Get the geographic location that corresponds to the specified point in the viewport of the Map control.

segment.source: GetOffsetFromLocation method - Get the point in the viewport of the Map control that corresponds to the specified geographic location.
segment.target: GetOffsetFromLocation method - Get the point in the viewport of the Map control that corresponds to the specified geographic location.

segment.source: IsLocationInView method - Determine whether the specified geographic location is currently visible in the viewport of the Map control.
segment.target: IsLocationInView method - Determine whether the specified geographic location is currently visible in the viewport of the Map control.

segment.source: FindMapElementsAtOffset method - Get the elements on the map located at the specified point in the viewport of the Map control.
segment.target: FindMapElementsAtOffset method - Get the elements on the map located at the specified point in the viewport of the Map control.

segment.source: Handle user interaction and changes
segment.target: Handle user interaction and changes

segment.source: Handle user input gestures on the map by handling the following events of the MapControl.
segment.target: Handle user input gestures on the map by handling the following events of the MapControl.

segment.source: Get info about the geographic location on the map and the physical position in the viewport where the gesture occurred by checking the values of the Location and Position properties of the MapInputEventArgs.
segment.target: Get info about the geographic location on the map and the physical position in the viewport where the gesture occurred by checking the values of the Location and Position properties of the MapInputEventArgs.

segment.source: MapTapped
segment.target: MapTapped

segment.source: MapDoubleTapped
segment.target: MapDoubleTapped

segment.source: MapHolding
segment.target: MapHolding

segment.source: Determine whether the map is loading or completely loaded by handling the control's LoadingStatusChanged event.
segment.target: Determine whether the map is loading or completely loaded by handling the control's LoadingStatusChanged event.

segment.source: Handle changes that happen when the user or the app changes the settings of the map by handling the following events of the MapControl.
segment.target: Handle changes that happen when the user or the app changes the settings of the map by handling the following events of the MapControl.
